ygData.subject: Re: Quest Help(riverdale)
ygData.msgSnippet: Also what I hear, you must target yourself when healing, I don t know what will happen if you target a party member, it would be nice if you could heal them
ygData.messageBody:
Also what I hear, you must target yourself when healing, I don't know what
will happen if you target a party member, it would be nice if you could heal
them too. If you give the ring to someone, if they try to use it, it fails,
and if they turn it into the clerics guild, they don't get it back.

This means: Do not buy it from a player, if you didn't earn it, you won't
be able to use it.

Also if you lower your faction with Rivervale residents, it will cease to be
rechargeable until you raise the faction back up.

Wenaddar the rambling bard.



> -----Original Message-----
> From: Schafer, Timothy L 1425 [SMTP:Timothy.Schafer@...]
> Sent: Friday, July 02, 1999 3:25 PM
> To: 'EQ-Quest@onelist.com'
> Subject: Re: [EQ-Quest] Quest Help(riverdale)
>
> From: "Schafer, Timothy L 1425" <Timothy.Schafer@...>
>
> It supposedly heals between 80-100 hps, it's a single charge item, however
> the cleric's guild will recharge it for free.
>
> So it's somewhat endless, but after each use, you have to get it
> recharged.
>
> Also, after several uses, it will just disappear. You must return to the
> deputy who gave it to you and ask him, again "Am I one with the wall" he
> will then return the ring.
>
> So when fighting Nillipuss, if you use the ring, make sure you are
> prepared
> to get to the bank should the ring disappear. I saw it happen, it gets
> kinda scary.
>
> Wenaddar
>
>
> > -----Original Message-----
> > From: Jeff [SMTP:jeffh@...]
> > Sent: Friday, July 02, 1999 2:37 PM
> > To: EQ-Quest@onelist.com
> > Subject: Re: [EQ-Quest] Quest Help(riverdale)
> >

> > >
> > > What are stats on the ring and exactly what does it do and what do you
> > use
> > > it for?
> > >
> >
> > I think it is jus ta one shot greater heal.
> >
